Reviews.Title: “Clean, reasonably priced, good area”
Reviews.Author: Nicoc
Reviews.Content: After living several years in Amsterdam, I often go back and Conscious Vondelpark is my preferred choice. Fun to simply discover your room with all ecologic solutions (ok, some of them a bit forced, but the concept is there!). Cean, modern and with a resonable price if you book ahead. The Overtoom area is well packed with restaurants (etnic and not) and offers a "local" alternative to the overtouristic Leidseplein. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: I_will_take_you_home
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel to Amsterdam about once a year for fun. We chose the Conscious hotel because it looked descent and there were rooms available. The whole experience was a little disappointing. The hotel staff were professional enough, and although the rooms were really small they were clean. The hotel felt very corporate and it was clear that their policies prioritized their making money over creating an enjoyable authentic experience for travelers. Sure every hotel has to make money, but you shouldn't feel it when you walk in. Corporate headquarters must have decided to make every guest sign of on the fee structure for smoking in the rooms (150euro) or messing with the smoke detector (250euro). Nothing really lived up to the cool cafe vibe they attempted to create in the lobby. The whole "conscious" theme is a bit of a sham. Putting little environmental signs all over the room and eliminating the shower curtain in favor of an open door seemed to be the extent of the green design. The dumb sayings plastered on the door of every room are tacky. The tram is close by, but it is sill a bit of a hassle getting into downtown. It is a solid 20 minute brisk walk to Leidsplien. I won't stay with them again. There are too many other cool hotels in better areas at the same price point.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: KR1212
Reviews.Content: Hotel Conscious is modern, clean and quiet; the bathroom is palatial compared to most Amsterdam hotels (where it is--literally--a water closet!); mattress is very comfortable. I appreciated the ecoconsciousness and the reduction of waste at this hotel. The hotel is right on the no. 1 tram line (stop Overtoomsesluis), which makes getting around very easy. From Schiphol, you can take the train station to A'dam Lelyland and then the no. 1 tram from there--much less hassle than going to Central Station. This is a nice place to stay outside of the hysterical center, which is full of stoned tourists and dingy, dirty hotels, but still convenient. I didn't have the breakfast, but the bar in the front lobby serves coffee and pastries, which were good. I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “First choice for budget travller”
Reviews.Author: InvisibleMo
Reviews.Content: Staff is very friendly and helpful. Very new decor & clean room and the size is acceptable. Price/Quality ratio is very high. Breakfast is very delicious. It is located right next to the tram station and 20 mins from Amsterdam Centraal station to there. Nearby you may find a restaurant called Pizza Bakker which serves excellent pizza!

Reviews.Title: “Good price, basic with a twist”
Reviews.Author: Walco
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel the first weekend in January, attracted by the decent room price. Found hotel to be clean, modern & functional. Communal reception / bar area was a really nice environment to sit, read / chill out in. Fab window seats allows great opportunity to watch the world go by. Drinks prices were quite expensive for a hotel out of the central area (perhaps that's why!). Rooms were on the small side (expected for a city hotel) and the minimal design did feel a little sparse but was spot on for a weekend base to explore the city. Staff were really friendly & gave us a great recommendation for a small nearby cafe to eat at & we enjoyed a delicious lunch there. We ate breakfast at the hotel one morning for convenience and whilst we liked it we were aware that there are cheaper alternatives elsewhere. Hotel location is out of the busy central part of Amsterdam but very easily accessible by tram right outside the hotel. Buy a 3 day tram pass and getting around the city is never an issue. Vondelpark sits behind the hotel and with a very short walk to the park entrance we enjoyed several strolls through the park and as a route into the city, choosing this as an alternative to the tram. We would stay at the hotel again & would recommend it to anyone looking to explore the city on a budget. Rated 4* for what it is, not in comparison to ALL hotels & categories. Constructive feedback for management: found reception check in / out slow so somewhat frustrating. Nail that to further improve customer experience :-) Shower was good but spray did go all over the bathroom floor so care needed when stepping out not to slip...bigger bath mat?

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: leelee561
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the conscious hotel for 5 nights. Hands down the coolest staff. They were so helpful in finding the best restaurants and fun night spots to eat and hang out in. A must see is the madelief which is literally 2 blocks away and the best dining experience we had. Another fav was the moralang. Best bar we thought was 3 sisters pub. But back to the conscious hotel...super clean, cozy white fluffy blankets, black out curtains (just in case you need to sleep in ) and the best organic beer. We had a blast talking and hanging out with the bartender who happened to be the front desk workers as well. Also, not that it matters ;) but EVERYONE was good looking and went above and beyond to make our experience the best. This trip was last year but we are planning to go again next month..and I know where I will be staying!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff and awesome room with an eco-touch! The perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nnssxx
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect! No, really, EVERYTHING! The staff is lovely, the hotel and rooms are super clean and quiet, even with the tramway (line 1) being literally 5 meters away from the hotel door (super convenient!). The price range is very good for Amsterdam, and the Vondelpark is really nice too! I will definitely go back to this hotel next time I visit Amsterdam! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: BaMi P
Reviews.Content: We traveled for vacation with my girlfriend and baby. We asked for y quiet room which we had. The staff was friendly and helpfull, the room was clean ! The downs side is that the location is far but easy to access with the tram/train... The price is note cheap but seems ok for the city... The shower has a waterconsumption reducer so it goes for cold to hot, which is not so nice..

Reviews.Title: “Charged in advance most 36%, and returned only 20% !!”
Reviews.Author: Sergio Seiji I
Reviews.Content: Hotel very nice, modern but impersonal. Lack soul. Just found out I was robbed after I left. We made reservations for 10 hotels and none of them had this problem.

Reviews.Title: “simple but worthwhile...”
Reviews.Author: theshirtshop
Reviews.Content: a simple but worthwhile stay, if you prefer a quieter yet still convenient location... paid â‚¬85 for a superior room, definitely 'worth it' for amsterdam... bathroom spacious, room basic but comfortable...no complaints, would certainly recommend onward..

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: federicoa
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, modern and in a good position to join in a few steps Van Gogh Museum and the city centre. What we didn't expect was the poor and expensive breakfast ( 12â‚¬ added per person) we found. No cakes, croissants or any "sweet" food (you had to pay an extra ) apart from some fruit jam, eggs, ham and cheese.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: metbolt Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 2 nights with my partner and another couple. the staff were extremely helpful and polite, very relaxed atmosphere at the hotel, especially in the lounge area. nice and quiet at night, and very secure hotel and hotel rooms, the safe was especially appreciated. tram stop right outside the door which was excellent, and tram tickets were available to buy from the hotel reception. beautiful rooms and huge beds, which were so comfortable!! although the only downfall was the 10minute wait because the receptionist could not find my booking, which resulted in not getting the room i requested (with a balcony) but i think this was down to the "easy to book"website and not the hotel itself. but the receptionists were very helpful and found me another room, so i do not think i would book through this website again, as it caused a bit of panic.

Reviews.Title: “Just good and not expensive”
Reviews.Author: Bartho0
Reviews.Content: Hip and cool hotel in Amsterdam, with a relaxed atmosphere. The reception was a bit messy and we were suprised that we had to pay the city tax and breakfast in advance. We also had to sign to promise not to smoke in the room. The hotel consists of an A-and B-tower, that means 2 houses in 2 blocks, connected by a corridor. The corridors are bit of a dark maze. The room itself was fresh, not large, but neat and had a neat bathroom. We had a good and quit sleep. Tram 1 stops right outside, 8 minutes to Leidseplein. The breakfast was good enough (â‚¬ 11.50), but nothing special. Free WIFI. Conscious Vondelpark is just a good and not too expensive hotel has a good public transport to the city centre. Take also a relaxing walk in the Vondel-Park, just around the corner. We have also stayed once in Conscious Museumsquare, the rooms were bigger there and the location was closer to the center, but was a little more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: Jsunset
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at this hotel and had a very good experience. Took the upgraded room, perhaps 10 euro more per night. it was in the back wing on the quiet street in the rear of the hotel. Nice size room, good bathroom, very clean and quiet. it's a simple room but nicely done and the staff were friendly. For this price in Amsterdam, I can certainly recommend this hotel. Right next to Vondel Park and 5 minutes to the city center are on a tram (stop right out front) or on a bike. Impressed.

Reviews.Title: “The best Hotel and City I have ever been to!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Senn M
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I plan on going back within the next few weeks and this WILL be my place of stay. This hotel was absolutly great. When I first walked in I was amazed to see how beautiful the place really was. The pictures are FORREAL! This place is really beautiful, and that was not to mention that the 1 Tram from Cental station stops directly infront of the hotel. This was too convient. Even though your not in the Red Light district area the tram from the district bring you straight here. When I checked in i was giving a room on the B side, after taking the elevator up and walking across to the other side my key did not work so I went back down stairs, in the midst the cleaning supervisor was in the hall and I asked her was there any rooms availible in the front because being a woman alone I didnt feel comfortable doing that walk later to my room at late night alone. She quickly told me that room 116 was clean and availible and that she was calling the front desk to have me changed. By the time I got down there the front desk person was already on the phone with her and changing my room. She told me that I didnt need to explain and that it was ok. OMG When I walked in the room I was at a awww at how cozy and nice the room looked and felt. It felt like an 5star hoel just smaller. Actually I have been in 5star hotels and none of them had flavor like unless its like the Wynn in Vegas. Everything looked brand new and spanking clean. It took a second to realize how to turn the light on because you have to put your room key in a slot on the wall to turn on the power in the room to save energy and when you take it out to leave the room everything shuts off. Once I sat down on the bed I was then confirmed that I choose the best play to stay in Amsterdam. The bed was soft as ever just how I love it. I layed down and it felt like the mattress was hugging me. I didnt have a problem not once with the free wii fi it worked with my laptop and ipod even at the same time. The day Time front desk people were so great. They advised me of everything I can experience. The night time guy on my 1st night wasnt too good but I will not hold the hotel responsible because when I did speak to the manager Xavier about it the next morning he was extra extra helpful and not accepting of non customer service, He went out of his way to help me. The next night guy and evening girls were so great. Since they have a bar in the lobby they just talked to me and laughed as I sat and enjoyed one of their home made smoothies. The night uy even took the time to print out time and directions for the tram to locations. My room was cleaned spotless, Tissue refilled. The only thing is the there isnt a iron or ironing board in your room and you have to get it from the front desk, and since they have a really big and good ironing board it was really heavy to loged back and forth to the front desk but it was cool. I stayed two nights here and like I said when I return I will be staying there again. Let me not forget that the Price was much much cheaper than those of te hotels I saw online and when I saw them in person they were run downed hotels. I know my review may sound like im a worker there trying to big up the hotel but im not. Im just a NY traveler who travels alot and I appreciate getting my moneys worth. I would reccommend this place to everyone

Reviews.Title: “Great value, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rigatti
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on a recent trip and greatly enjoyed our stay. Rooms were small but cute, clean and modern, staff was friendly and helpful, and overall I felt like it was a great value. The location is quiet and untouristy but it is a bit of a haul to get to the main attractions. That's what bikes are for though! Vondelpark is right there too, so you can bike through it and avoid traffic (not that it's much of an issue with the dedicated bike lanes). Overall we were very satisfied with our stay

Reviews.Title: “Very nice eco-friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: oni_lovely
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night. It was easy to found from Schiphol Airport. Just take train to Amsterdam Lelyaan, after that take tram no 1 to Central Station. Then stop at Overtoom. The hotel location just in front of the tram Overtoom. But if you carry a lot of things, better just take taxi since u need to change train & to tram. I came there after my trip to Barcelona, with a lot of luggage & belongings and it was quite troublesome. When I came there & made the payment for the room, they said they didn't have the standard room & they only have the premium room which a bit more expensive but had bigger room. I also had asked for room with double bed, but they said the room was unavailable since it was Valentine's day and the hotel quite fully booked. Since I asked for room not facing the street side, they gave me the room at tower B which quite far from the lobby. With many things to bring, it was quite frustrating to found my room. But my room was nice & big. The bed was very comfortable. And the bathroom were big & spacious. I had a very pleasant stay here. One of my problem was the shower didn't have door so after I took my bath, the water were everywhere. Maybe the management can consider to put the door together with the bath, so that guest won't spent more towels to clean the floor. Tram to go to Dam Square is just in front of the hotel. It take around 15 minutes to reach Central Station. From there, u just can walk and go to Dam Square. It just too bad, the hotel isn't near Dam Square. Actually I stayed for 1 night only. I had asked for the staff last time how much if I wanted to have late check out, they asked me to paid another 50 euro. Then I changed my mind, since my flight at 9pm the day after. I thought to do late check out. The hotel didn't provide number to called the lobby, so I called from my mobile instead. And from the staff she said she doesn't have any room available for tomorrow, all was fully booked and I must check out tomorrow. And the day after, I tried my luck again & called the lobby to asked whether I could do late check out, and the guy staff said I could do it ! I was surprise since the day before the other staff insisted I couldn't stay since it was fully booked. And the guy said his colleagues didn't know I stayed at premium room and I could do late check out at 6 pm (his colleague that I asked the day before said if I wanted to do late check out, I must check out at 5 pm) ! Very nice ! Too bad, I couldn't remember his name. And I didn't know that if I did late check out, the hotel won't clean my room. So when I came back from Dam Square I still found out my room was messy. And I asked the lobby staff to gave me new towels. I need to wait for 30 minutes but all the housekeeping person never came, so I called the lobby again and within 10 minutes, I got 5 new towels ! So nice ! Will consider to stay at this hotel again. But overall, I really enjoy stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...”
Reviews.Author: gemma105
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights during February half term. The hotel is a good 15-20 minute walk from the main centre of the city. It was easy to find. We took the 197 bus from the airport (4E each) which was nice and simple. The hotel itself suited our needs fine. The room was a reasonable size and was very clean. Hotel staff were friendly. During our time in Amsterdam, the weather was freezing (the canals had frozen over) but our hotel room was always warm. We liked the quirkiness of the eco messages around the room explaining how the window sills were made from recycled coffee cups etc. Overall, we would definately recommend this hotel for visiting Amsterdam, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Ebba_Sve
Reviews.Content: From the beginning of the stay I was warmly welcomed and personnel was very friendly and polite. Whole hotel and room was very tidy. Beds were comfortable and rooms very quiet. As a runner the location next to Vondelpark was perfect to me. It was easy to start your day with a morning run in the park and after that had a delicious and organic breakfast. Tram goes right next to the hotel which is totally bonus. I can warmly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “VERY VERY VERY BAD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: SAF101
Reviews.Content: disrespectful...impolite...lie in bed photos...small room...cold room...despots...I mixed it my room without permission...not appear in the picture at the hotel, the building back on the street is that you need ...Do not go Do not..... very very bad

Reviews.Title: “The Conscious Hotel Vondelpark Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: fforbes212
Reviews.Content: This being my first time in Amsterdam,I decided to try out a different type of hotel from the ones I usually stay in.Most of the hotels I stay in are four or five stars,with tons of amenities.So this time around I wanted to expand my travel horizons.Which lead me to staying at the Conscious Hotel Amsterdam.It is located in the Vondelpark section of Amsterdam. The Vondelpark is a public urban park of 47 hectares (120 acres) in Amsterdam, Netherlands. It is located in the stadsdeel Amsterdam Oud-Zuid, west from the Leidseplein and the Museumplein. Centrally located and a 15 minute tram ride from the center of town.The tram is located directly in front of the hotel.So its a quick 1 tram ride from Amsterdam's Centraal Station. Upon entering the hotel lobby after getting off a train from Antwerp at Centraal Station.I was little bit tired,sweaty,and hungry.I arrived at around 12 in the afternoon.Approaching the desk I was met by a very warm smile.Welcoming me to Amsterdam and the hotel,telling him my name we were told our room wasn't ready.Which was fine I went out and explored Amsterdam. Coming back a couple of hours later the room was available .The room was typical to european standards..smaallll.but that is to be expected.This being a eco hotel that means no control of the air condition.I t was sent from the lobby.No refrigerator in the room so no midnight snacks.I don't ever use the snacks provided .I often use it to store things I have purchased during the day from the local supermarket(wine,cheese,fruit).This was a slight inconvenience,actually more than a slight inconvenience.Also after a long day of touring a little ice would be nice with my drink.For you to get ice you had to go to the lobby to get it.After asking they only gave you a cup of ice for two people.They also asked why you needed the ice.Why i needed the ice?Are you serious? The shower was also not that great,I don't know if it had to do with conservation or poor plumbing.The room was decorated nicely in a plant theme,most of the rooms in the hotel ,as well as the lobby have a eco plant theme going on.The bathrooms was clean and efficient and unusually big.I almost wish they had taken a little less room for the bathroom and added a little of that space for the actual room itself. So if you have a chance to visit one of my favorite cities in the world.You can take a chance on The Conscious Hotel.Some might love it while others might hate it.I personally depending on the time of day felt both.For the price and location you can't beat it,so this might tip the scales for some.Either way travel,explore,and as always be safe. I have some pictures from my stay here: http://atravelbugg.com/2012/01/13/the-conscious-hotel-vondelpark-amsterdam/

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great front desk best deal!”
Reviews.Author: Milan M
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Amsterdam with the family (2 young kids). wanted a nice hotel not to expensive that is not smack in the center of town. I could not be happier to stay at the Conscious Hotel Vondelpark! 10 minutes from the center, nice clean rooms, decent breakfast and best of all GREAT STAFF!!! helped with anything I needed or requested. I'm planning my trip to AMS again and hope to be able to get rooms at the this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No coffee or tea facilities in room”
Reviews.Author: Alichia58
Reviews.Content: Good location, No.1 Tram stops right in from of hotel and takes you into the city centre. I requested a twin room but was given a double room. In the corridor outside our room was a dirty glass and spoon which was there for more than 24 hours. We had such a lovely time discovering Amsterdam that we only realised the next morning that the linen was quite badly stained. Staff were absolutely lovely, friendly and very helpful. Good location but very basic. Maybe just me, but I've never stayed in a hotel without coffee and tea facilities, even the youth hostels I've stayed in had coffee and tea facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean and spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: punitworld
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this Hotel for one night and found this to be conveniently located in middle of restaurants. Very well maintained rooms that are clean, eco-friendly and reasonable sized. Also, staff is very very friendly and helps you to best they can. Hotel has a paid parking and some very good restaurants around. Hotel breakfast is ordinary. While all was good, one needs to keep in mind that pathways inside Hotel resemble a zig saw puzzle with you having open at least 5 doors and take 2 elevators (in your room is in Tower B)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: epj123
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late due to airport issues and were greeted warmly by the reception team and offered a drink straight away â€“ perfect. The rooms are great, small but functional. All a very interesting hotel, being green etc makes it have some quirky and amusing features â€“ plants growing out of the wall in the bar being one of them. Breakfast was great. No frills or fuss. Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “simple and good”
Reviews.Author: frostie9999
Reviews.Content: Hi, this is prefect, simple to get to from the airport, 4 euro. Smack bang in all the museums, twenty min walk into town or five mins on the number 5 tram tickets from reception. Staff very friendly and the hotel very clean. Would I stay again? YES. Done the red light, done the Anne frank museum I personally would go on the last day because it is very emotional and you do not want to be walking around Amsterdam thinking of exactly what went on, you are on holiday costs 8-euro book online to avoid ques but a most see. Went into a cafe as well and what ever you do just get one and share it, or else you will be in bed at eight, bad times. enjoy your stay hopefully i will be back

Reviews.Title: “Good! a lovely place to stay and affordable”
Reviews.Author: anbil
Reviews.Content: A great modern hotel with a recycling theme and very good price. room was lovely and nicely decorated.situated within easy reach of the centre of Amsterdam. staff were very friendly and helpful.would definately stop there again

Reviews.Title: “Patronising Boutique Chic”
Reviews.Author: RobNIkAmslon
Reviews.Content: Hi Travellers to amsterdam. I went early december 2011, booked online via booking.com and got accordding to websites a very good deal 320Euro for 4nights, premium room tower b. In high season you can pay almost double that and more at this hotel. Room was clean, comfortable but quite basic in design, it is basically breeze block room with a rubbish wall mural and grey industrial carpet, heavy black curtains but next to residential homes which can be quite noisy at times. LCD tv pathetic and way to small for a premium room but it did have all the channels and crstyal clear picture. Wifi throughout hotel(gratis) and work very well in my room. I asked for a double but got 2 singles squashed together. Always annoys me. Bathroom clean, good hot shower, with usual amenities but no tea/coffee making facilities. This hotel gimmick is an eco model, water saving features, heating, etc but I found the constant stickers next to plug points, in bathroom on the hotel doors quite condescending, patronising. Hotel is quite big, tower A Tower B with many rooms, if you get tower B be prepared for a good walk to your room and upstairs. Staff are good, quite funny and friendly, lobby, bar area very smart. Breakfast 13 euro. Just walk across the road to Albert Hein and breakfast is 2euro. I have lived in amsterdam on and off for 7yrs. Between homes I stay in Hotels, been in many a dutch hotel room at all times of the year and I speak Dutch. so when I say this is good bargain to be had in low season but in high season given its location(overtoom at the very bottom) long bike ride or walk to Leisdseplein I would not stay here. The choice is yours, 7/10 overall.

Reviews.Title: “Good value of money....”
Reviews.Author: JOETTA32
Reviews.Content: Conscious Hotel Voldelpark is a cozy hotel, new, modern, clean but nothing is for free. Expensive parking charge, 22eur per day, breakfast 13 eur per person etc....but has a very stylish lobby area, very friendly and warm for coffee. The room coud be a little more bigger. The bathroom has enough space. Very convenient to the public transport, about 20 minutes walking from the centre but if you travel by car, believe this is a big problem in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Good! Simple & affordable with some style”
Reviews.Author: Solaster
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel for the price - it was the cheapest hotel I could find last minute on a 5 night trip to Amsterdam in December 2011. It is a budget hotel; simple amenities in the room and a slightly out of the way location. However, it is styled very nicely, so it stills feels fun & like you're on vacation. In addition, the staff is very nice. My husband and I like to walk, and even in typical Dutch winter weather found the walk from the hotel to various sights and Central Station enjoyable and not too time consuming. I imagine in nice weather it would be down right pleasant. The breakfast in the hotel is quite good and not too expensive; the first morning we did not have the breakfast and walked quite far before we found a suitable spot and probably paid the same amount in the end; so the next four mornings we ate at the hotel. It would be a nice addition to the breakfast if hot chocolate was available! There is a small bar in the lobby where drinks can be ordered at any time; we had hot chocolate or drinks late every night after hoofing it back from Central Station. The bed was good - but the pillow are of the awful neck breaking variety I hate and often find in hotels . . . so I'm beginning to think maybe it is just me and most people love these huge pillows. This hotel could make a few small additions to add to the budget appeal of it's accommodations; a mini fridge and kettle would be awesome, allowing guests to take advantage of nearby groceries and affordable take-out spots to save money. I would pay a little extra for an "enhanced" room that included these features. I would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best location...”
Reviews.Author: PriscilaO
Reviews.Content: Location is one of the most important things for me when choosing a hotel, that's why I was a little disappointed with the Conscious Hotel. You can take a tram in front of the hotel to get to the center, but it's far away to go walking everyday. The hotel itself is good, nice breakfast, friendly staff and cool atmosphere, with an eco-friendly touch. The room is a little small.

Reviews.Title: “3,8 km from center but well connected”
Reviews.Author: traveler-art
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights. The maximum temperature outside was 10C and the first might we nearly froze. This hotel is eco-friendly and they shut down the heater when a host leaves. They never told us and as we got there at 7PM the room was cold. After that lesson learned, the following night was fine even if there's a constant air fan regenerating the room's air, as we were told, which didn't make it cozy enough. The standard rooms are smaller than expected specially the bathroom but it's clean and new. Staff is friendly even if asking for a room in tower B wasn't specially well received by the woman that checked us in: "you're just guessing" she replied when I asked her for a room looking towards the park (following other TripAdvisor tips)

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel Apart”
Reviews.Author: tpclapham
Reviews.Content: My only complaint about this hotel is that I only stayed for one night. I had an overnight layover and booked the hotel based on reviews from other travelers and wasn't disappointed. It is away from the hustle of the city center, but a tram to Leisdensplein and the main train station in the city center stops literally at the front door. The staff were incredibly helpful- I arrived a day early and had booked through Expedia and the front desk clerk allowed me to use the hotel phone to call Expedia to change my arrival date. I wish I could have stayed longer and explored the large park behind the property, but will be staying here again for sure the next time I visit Amsterdam. Note that the beds are twins, pushed together, as is the European style.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: bridget-x
Reviews.Content: i stayed at conscious for a night on the 24th november 2011. the hotel is incredibly clean, smart and modern. i like that it had a eco-friendly twist, most things are recycled and the bathroom has little notes about little changes that have been made to help the environment. we didn't eat at the hotel but there are a few restaurants around. the staff were incredibly friendly and the beds were so comfy! i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rogerioprolo
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a two night stay at the Conscious Hotel Vondelpark, and was quite happy with it. The rooms are a decent size, the bed was big and comfortable, if I can complain about something it would be he oversized pillows, but having said that if a pillow is over one inch high it's oversized to me. Toilet was nice and clean, however a door, or curtain, on the shower box would be nice. Room and toilet were clean, but the wall needed a lick of paint, as it was full of marks. Staff was always friendly and happy to help. Did not have breakfast, thought 10euro per person was a bit overpriced. It's a bit far from the centre, but the tram that takes you there stops right in front of the hotel, but do yourself a favour and walk through Vondelpark. All in all a good hotel for the price, would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Parismast
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 days there and it was awesome!i went with my girlfriend and we had a great time!The hotel is brand new!the rooms are clean but they could be a little more spacious!Comfortable beds,wifi free for every customer!A minor disadvantage is that there was no refrigerator!Great environment though and great people working there!Conscious hotel is one of my favorites!Good job guys!

Reviews.Title: “Some staff let this hotel down.”
Reviews.Author: Tom906
Reviews.Content: First i'll start with a positive. The rooms look as they do on the website and place is stylish - quite trendy if that floats your boat. However if you sctratch under the surface in my opinion its a little style over sustance. There are some lovely staff there in particular the female staff who seemed warm and genuinely welcoming. The one thing that massively let this place down was a male member of staff who seemed like he wanted to be elsewhere and unfortunately he left a final and lasting impression on the hotel. He seemed to work during the night (maybe that was his problem). The bar is open until 2pm which is great. However being served by someone eating a sandwich whilst chatting to another member of his team is not so great. I felt like an inconvenience. Also this person needs to take note of the following - when a customer books a shuttlebus to the airport its not because its highly necessary. Our shuttlebus that was booked did not turn up so we were a little worried about making our flight. He just shrugged his shoulders and said 'sometimes they don't show up' - NOT GOOD ENOUGH. He was not bothered at all and then asked if i wanted him to call the shuttlebus company up and order another life to the airport. Ludicrous question. OF COURSE we did as we wanted to catch our flight home. I felt like asking him if he wanted me to call them!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: J_Kim32761
Reviews.Content: Please do yourself a favor and stay here! My boyfriend and I had the most amazing stay here. The rooms are exactly as the pictures. Most places don't look like the pictures seen on their websites but this place looks exactly like it. It's clean, location is perfect, modern, and super environmentally friendly. I wish I had stayed here longer. If we go back to Amsterdam, we'll definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very environment conscious !!”
Reviews.Author: Shabster81
Reviews.Content: Great place and truly environment conscious. Stayed in standard rooms and the experience overall was good. Service was also great and it is just around 15-20 mins tram ride from the main train station. The tram actually stops right in front of the hotel so very convenient to travel around

Reviews.Title: “I doff my hat to the staff and the pizza joint next door...”
Reviews.Author: Andy H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Conscious Hotel Vondelpark for some relatively extended periods during August and September of this year. Almost 7 weeks in total. That's a long time, if something is irking you after a few days, you can guarantee you'll want to smash it after a few weeks. I felt no such urges. During this time, I moved around a few of the rooms, usually down to availability (point of note there, avoid the broadcasting seminar in August, Amsterdam sells out, even with rooms at triple rate), so tried out deluxe as well as standard rooms. If I'm honest, I wouldn't bother with the luxury rooms, unless you're partial to bathing (they have a bath and much bigger bathrooms) or need to dock your ipad/iphone constantly. So, my humble... Downsides? well, yes, I guess trekking to tower B was a bit of a pain, but only a minor twinge in the buttock rather than an utter bum ache. Yes, the rooms can be quite small, which can make things a bit tight with a big suitcase (but I still managed that and a Brompton folding bicycle) and yes, my god, the bathroom lighting is harsh, I was quite relieved upon my return to Berlin that I didn't look THAT bad. I suppose you could see the location as less than central, but personally, I'd rather be away from the Liedseplein and much closer to Vondelpark, which is truly beautiful. The tram is actually pretty quick, or you can walk into the centre in 20 mins, or even better, get a bike! More upsides, well firstly the staff, I think sometimes it's easy to misunderstand different cultures as rude, when in fact, they're just a little more efficient with their language than the English. Iâ€™m still learning to deal with this in Berlin. That said, I didn't find the staff at Vondelpark brusque at all. On every occasion they were very helpful, very well natured and quite willing to share some fun with you. On the occasions I was staring down the possibility of sofa surfing they did everything they could to find me rooms at good rates (I was on a budget, as my company, is well... 'me' so it comes out of my pocket). I found the rooms very clean, simple, stylish and exactly as described. Everything you need, but nothing else. No coffee making facilities, no small bottles of shower gel, no massive TV, then they never promised me these. I got all I was looking for, a clean, modern room, a comfortable bed and the Beeb. Any problems I had (an overflowing shower tray at one point) were dealt with quickly and efficiently. All-in-all my stay was very pleasant, I would definitely stay there again, in fact I look forward to it! I miss being greeted personally... and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to others. BTW - Iâ€™d also recommend 'De Pizzabakkers' next door, some of the best pizza Iâ€™ve ever had, better than Rome and Naples in my humble. So good in fact, that by the end of my stay, it wasn't just the hotel that was greeting me personally...

Reviews.Title: “Great beds, shame about the location”
Reviews.Author: Shillinglaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights in October 2011, It has been over 25 years since I had been to Amsterdam and boy has it changed. No, not the architecture but the vibe of the place - too many people, too many bikes, dirty with no respite from the relentless 'tourist experience' - but that's all another story. We had clear instruction to get the No 1 tram and this worked very well. Quite a fun and frantic ride and it dropped us right outside the hotel. We were in the rear 'B' block which was quiet and relativly peaceful. Quite a trek to our room No 220 on the first floor - everytime my partner was drawn down a different corridor but I have a better sense of direction so we didn't get lost! The room was small - there really isn't anyway to dress that up! We did like it though. The bed was very comfortable - memory foam, which I had never slept on before but we both agreed it was great. Not quite enough surfaces to put your stuff but one manages, the trendy little upsidedown hanging plant was cool but it did leave a tiny, sticky puddle on the chair underneath it - good job we didn't leave a clean white shirt on the chair! It was quite a warm spell and it was frustrating we couldn't open the window fully - just a small ventilation gap - other windows looked as if they were open fully - but not ours. The tiny shower room looked stylish but had it's own problems - the shower absolutly soaked the floor due to the open nature of the tray, very little space to put stuff and pretty hash lighting when using the mirror but, as I said, looked fab - form over function, depends what you look for in life. The green and recycled credentials I found slightly bogus - we are into that at home so it's not that we don't care - it just felt a little patronising but really it's a sensible and profitable way to run a hotel. The extractor fan in the shower room was on constantly when the card key was in the slot, the wash basin took too much water to fill, the dual flush on the WC was 'quirky'. Don't get me wrong, we did like the hotel but, like nearly every hotel we have ever stayed at, they are experts in self promotion and promise so much and deliver a very average experience. We didn't have breakfast - too expensive for what they were offering, we took our mini kettle and bought bakery items and had a jolly little breakfast for very little money in our room. The lobby seating area was not a big draw for us although we did like the 'green, living wall'. Reception staff were rather cold but efficient - we had nothing to do with them really but if we had a problem I guess they would have delt with it. Our soap and shower gel both ran out and they had to be told as cleaners didn't replace them - basic stuff I would have thought but going back to all the hype they make about themselves.... I wouldn't stay here again, not because it was dreadful but I've had the experience of the Concious Hotel and if I went again I would want to be nearer to the city. The tram was essential to get around but the novelty did wear off. It wasn't really very feasible to go back to the hotel throughout the day. We are in our 50's and are by no means lacking in energy but Amsterdam is exhausting and there is nowhere to step aside from the buzz and chill for half an hour - public seating is minimal. A hotel on one of the canal streets would have meant we could have popped back for a couple of hours before going out again. We were leaving our hotel at about 11am and getting back at about 9pm - that's a long day in a fast moving city. Hope this helps you with your trip to Amsterdam - have a great time, it is a place to experience at least once!

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: SonjaLondon
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at the last minute before a business trip and got a good rate online. On arrival, the reception team were very friendly and welcoming. They were very helpful in giving me directions and advice on public transport/traffic. My room was in the 2nd tower so a little ways to go but fine. It was clean and large with a comfortable bed. There weren't the usual extras like mini-fridges etc but I really didn't need them. There was no door or curtain on the shower so be mindful of where to place your floor towel! The hotel itself was interesting. There were lots of eco-friendly products used in the rooms from the soap and showerhead to the sheets and type of lighting used. I didn't have any problems using the internet in the lobby or in my room. Breakfast was quite standard. I hear there are cheaper options if you go outside but I didn't have time to explore that. One tip - take the hotel's free map on offer. The tourist office in the city charges for them!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I had expected”
Reviews.Author: MrsEJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in August 2011 for 3 nights. Based on other travellers reviews and their website it was exactly what I expected: clean, modern, friendly, a little far out of the center (I would highly recommend a bike). The rooms were not large but I was pleasantly surprised by the size of the bathroom. I would stay here again, not for a romantic or family holiday but was totally adequate for my purpose - hanging out for a few days en route elsewhere and getting in some shopping and exploring by bicycle.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for an Amsterdam stay”
Reviews.Author: Eud
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a five day stretch and this was a nice hotel. The first room I had was underwhelming - in the second tower and at the back with views of the neighbours. The internet was also misbehaving (supposedly was being upgraded so there was no free wireless). I was fortunate and upgraded to a top floor room in the first tower and it was very nice. That room initially couldn't get the net, then it could, then it couldn't but on the last day had no problems (maybe the internet upgrade got completed). The rooms are small - its Europe. The top floor room I was upgraded to though had its own outdoor patio - unfortunately there were no chairs on it but you could move ones out from your room. The showers were nice and you didn't notice that they were lower flow heads. The hotel has a 'groovy' feel with labels on items telling you how they were environmentally friendly. The downside of the top floor room is that the elevator only goes to 5 so you have to bring your luggage up two flights of stairs. There is a small bar/snack/coffee area in the lobby that always had some people kicking around even late into the night for a nice vibe - I suspect part of the reason though was that the net was down in a lot of areas and the lobby was the only place to get a connection. Parking is a good deal here (well, for Amsterdam, its still expensive but only about half what you would pay elsewhere). The downside is that to get in is a bit of a pain - all I could figure you could do was to get to it around back and then run around to the front of the hotel to get them to let you in (and there is no sign to tell you where it is so the first time I was past it and had to go around again as its a one way street around the back). If there was a buzzer to the front desk I was not made aware of it. The spots are tight as well, a large car would be a challenge for parking; doable but a challenge. The location is good - its near the park obviously and the tram is immediately outfront for quickly getting over to the center of town. There are a couple restaurants nearby that are good as well (the baked pizza place about a minute away was good value and tasty). There is a breakfast buffet that I didn't try available for 10 euro a day if you pre book which is probably not bad value considering what things generally cost elsewhere. One review mentioned the beds feeling lumpy/curved and I would concur, they were a bit odd. Its like they have a curve for you to sink into rather than a normal bed feel (that is flat). I am not sure if that is by design or if its just wonky/old beds - I suspect by design and you may or may not like it. I wasn't a huge fan of the sensation. All said though, a nice hotel in a good location that is good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Something different”
Reviews.Author: Austraveller49
Reviews.Content: What a great surprise to find a hotel where some fun and practical ideas are actually carried through. The quality of the rooms was very good with all the facilities except for coffee and tea in the room. Size was a little disappointing but manageable. The service from the front door to check out was excellent and everyone very helpful. Breakfast at an extra but reasonable cost was excellent with a good range. Location is a bit of a walk to the â€˜action centreâ€™. Our only problem was with the â€œdoorlessâ€� shower as we battled to control the water overspray onto the bathroom floor and subsequently soaked a bathmat everyday. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nature near oasis in crowded city”
Reviews.Author: pureperspective
Reviews.Content: I have been in quite a few hotels in amsterdam and now for the first time I want to share my experiences because I am so pleased with the hotel: First of all it is an "ORGANIC" forward thinking hotel meaning everything is designed to support the health and balance of you the visitor and the planet. the entire hotel has a very friendly "theme" and tries to interact with the visitor thanks to little stickers here and there pointing out fun facts about the interior. We personally enjoyed these little fun reminders and all in all I think it speaks of the ATTENTION TO DETAIL this hotel offers. Maybe it is exaggerated to say it has a soul but there is a good feeling in the air. The rooms we have been in are very comfortable because of the nature near feeling. Furniture carpets towels chairs table, everything feels kind of natural, safe and most important the interior feels like there is QUALITY to it! Not cheaply mass produced stuff but like a true DESIGN HOTEL. and for everybody with allergies or somebody who enjoys chemical free atmosphere this is the place to go. The climax of this overall VERY NATURAL FEEL is definitely the SUPERB BED. One of the best hotel beds I have been in. So soft and comfortable with a huge blanket. Everything was VERY CLEAN and WELL MAINTAINED. So the most important tasks are perfectly fulfilled: excellent bed for a great refreshing sleep, very pleasant atmosphere and good location. Another great plus is the VERY GOOD BREAKFAST with a LOT OF CHOICE. also very healthy food, of course all organic. and the asking price of 13 Euros for the breakfast is really good considering the QUALITY of the food. Service was VERY FRIENDLY and capable of fulfilling all of our requests. They have a nice little unique comfortable "nature" lobby where you can buy cool organic/conscious gifts. The place of the hotel is great because it is just 5 min from the biggest and (I think nicest ) park in amsterdam the vondelpark. tram is near just in front of the hotel so there is an excellent connection.There is a raw food restaurant just 5 min away and a lot of other really good places to enjoy good food! only probable down site: If you are somebody who enjoys sitting all day in your hotel room I would choose another hotel because during daytime you have the street in front of your window which is not really annoying but could be a distraction when you want absolute silence. but in this case you shouldn't choose any city hotel at all. in the night there is no real noise and the excellent beds make up for it BIG time. All in all we will DEFINITELY COME BACK whenever we are here. The youthful stylish progressive atmosphere is just excellent. Everybody who enjoys organic or a healthy lifestyle should choose this over any other hotel in amsterdam. Also for this price point I think it is impossible to find any other hotel with such a comfortable and clean atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints.”
Reviews.Author: fyrmun37
Reviews.Content: Clean, good value, courteous staff. Convenient as it was right at a #1 tram stop.

Reviews.Title: “Can be found a better hotel for the same money”
Reviews.Author: rovas
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the good things. The hotel is in a nice neighborhood near the center of Amsterdam. Moving to the city center is easy tram stop is opposite the entrance. Premium rooms are clean and large enough. The beds are comfortable, according to our criteria. The rest: Foolish design. Our room had a bathroom with a large excess space, in contrast, small wardrobe and no mini bar. As part of the hotel called "tower B" has no WiFi, although in web site they write that there is one. Watching how the lobby is filled nightly with people trying to use the internet, I can assume that the situation was not better in other parts of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Going green never felt better”
Reviews.Author: Plino
Reviews.Content: We stayed in September 2011 in this hotel which is very new (probably less than a year old). It is so new that google street does not show it. The concept is a green one; organic food, organic materials, responsible use of energy, recycling but do not be afraid it is so comfortable that you will probably think why this is not widespread. It is located on a few steps away from Vondelpark which is a real jogging paradise (i did not run but apparently everyone else did). The area is very nice and there are several restaurants very close. To get there with the car is very easy at least if your GPS is working well. It is not possible to park in the front of the hotel but you can drive around (first rigth) and follow the street to the parking entry in the back of the hotel; it is normally closed but you can at least leave the car there and go to the reception by foot. I recommend to reserve a parking slot because in Amsterdam is very difficult and expensive. To visit the city you can use the efficient public transport in Amsterdam (24/48/72 hours ticket) or rent a bike. The Hotel is located in front of a Tram stop. the hotel has a reception in the ground floor and two "towers" with rooms. The tower A is closer to the street and the tower B is closer to the Park. The size of the rooms is very pleasent, the bath is also roomy. As everything is still new you will not find anything to complain. The bed was so nice and the pillows too. We took the breakfast (10 â‚¬ p.p.) which is not bad if you consider that Amsterdam is expensive, the excellent quality of the ingrediants (bio products) and the fact that is a buffet with fresh coffee (Expresso, Capuchino etc.). If you only take a coup of coffee then it is too much. The design is very modern, with a lot of details and funny things.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel would definately stay here again if we return to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: sockman2
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived we bought a travel card or their equivelent for the trams buses etc the trams run all over the city and it was a great way to travel around also as the hotel is a bit far to walk to and the tram stops right out side the hotel and leaves from right in front of the train station. We didn`t take up the offer of breakfast as we considered it expensive and there are plenty of restaurants to choose from. But the hotel its self was lovely clean and tidy the area around the hotel felt safe at anytime of day, and although the room was probably a bit on the small side it had everything we needed and was beautifully decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but needs some improuvment in management”
Reviews.Author: rochlaurentprive
Reviews.Content: Hi, We stayed in this hotel for one night in august 2011. The reservation was made on internet at a good rate (95 Eur for a premium room). The hotel is very nice. We liked the "green" conept. 2 days before arrival I called the hotel to book a parking place (22,5 EUR for 24h). It's cheaper than parking in the street. The parking is just under tower B of the hotel (back of the hotel). During this phone call they proposed me a room with a balcony as one was still available . When I checked in the room number was scratched on the reservation paper and replaced by another one. When I complained the receptionist discussed with his colleague saying in Dutch that I'ts not there fault if I did not received the room that I ASKED. Saddly for them I understand ducth and stopped them in the conversation to tell that I did not asked for the balcony room and that it had been proposed to me. The guy just said it's collegue should'nt have offered me something thet they did not had. I think they gave the room to someone else and that's all. Not very proffessional. Check in was a real pain. I never spent that much time checking in... 15 min (not including the balcony room argue). We paid 10 Eur per person for the breakfast wich is good but nothing special. Choices of food is just ok compared to many other breafast buffet I had in simillar category hotels. Renewing of the buffet (espacially the hot part: sausages and eggs) is very slow also. The room are nice. Nice bathroom, Good bedroom size. very minimalist but we liked it. No airco (but we knew it). I don't found the bed very good. It's not bad but it's a bit soft. I preffer stronger bed. The soap in the douche was empty. They put dispenser wich is "green" but they should at least be sure that it's been refilled. Not a bad experience... but could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Practical â€“ and in-your-face ecofriendly, in a good way!”
Reviews.Author: LassiK
Reviews.Content: A stylish hotel with lots of character: it does a good job explaining to you why things are the way they are (eco-friendly), even if the badges are quite in-your-face at times. I can't complain: slept like a saint knowing my stay isn't as hard on the planet as nights in many other hotels. Add to that the nice location next to Vondelpark (although I heartily recommend having bikes to travel around town!), and it's worth picking. For breakfast though go for the Caffe Oslo on the other side of the canal.

Reviews.Title: “Very reasonably priced, convenient and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: oh1984
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here in July after we booked to visit Amsterdam for a long weekend. The hotel is very tastefully fitted out, with a contemporary 'green' theme, and the rooms, although fairly basic, provide everything you need for a weekend getaway. The bed was really comfortable, and I especially liked the double shower in the bathroom. The hotel is located a small distance outside of the main hub of the city centre, but in my opinion this was a blessing in disguise as it meant we got a peaceful sleep each night. There is also the Vondelpark not too far away. The number 1 tram stop is directly outside the main entrance and this runs more or less every 10 minutes into the city centre. You can buy 24/48/72 hour travel cards so this makes the tram a fairly cheap way to get around. We couldn't fault the hotel staff, all very friendly and willing to help out with any questions or queries.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, charming, easy tram access--we'll be back again”
Reviews.Author: beautifultree12
Reviews.Content: It was no surprise that this great hotel had great reviews. I was drawn to the eco part and the price. Not right in the centre of things, but with a tram pass, you can easily get anywhere in no time. We got to Amsterdam (jet-lagged) in the morning and were told we couldn't check-in until 2pm. So we had lunch and wandered around a bit, enjoying what there is to enjoy in Amsterday, and returned at 2 to be told we could check in then or wait an additional 30 minutes for an upgraded room. Very glad we waited. We were on the top floor with access to our own private balcony. Beautiful. My only complaint was that there was no door or curtain to the shower which left quite a wet mess after bathing. Otherwise--great! If you are a night owl, there isn't a lot to do in vondelpark after about 10pm, and be careful to catch the last tram back or you'' be stucking walking or shelling out for a cab. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: bigjezzer
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Amsterdam, so we didn't know the ropes. The hotel was handy enough, just a 10 mins tram trip into the hustle and bustle and there were two very friendly bars within 400 yards. For a hotel that prides itself on it's green and eco policies, we thought they let themselves down a bit, especially with the flat bottomed sink in the bathroom that required a lot of hot water in it before we could wash and shave. Lighting in the room was overkill for many different moods, and used a lot of electricity if one couldn't decide on a mood and had the lot on! The room was OK for an overnight stay, but anything longer means one is struggling for drawer space to put folded clothes - because there isn't any! But our main gripe was the lack of tea and coffee making facilities in the room, our only option being to use the 24/7 bar at E2.20 for a tea! That's certainly not the way all hotels do it in Amsterdam because we checked. That meant we had to use the lift down and up five floors, so a lot of electricity wasted there too. At E100+ a night room rate, the help yourself breakfast also wasn't up to much, with people often waiting for hot food to appear. CafFe Oslo just over the canal did a great plateful for half the price. Not somewhere we would stay again, but we want to go back to Amsterdam, so maybe we should be prepared to pay a bit more next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Anne123456789
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a few steps from all Amsterdam major attractions, few tourists around! The room are confortable and well equiped. Bathrooms are moderns and functional

Reviews.Title: “Trendy eco-friendly hotel, far from the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: panoskaran
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a weekend in this hotel. This was actually our second visit. Design is very trendy and original. Warm, clean and "boutique" feeling. Rooms are not very large, but that is common in Amsterdam. The location is a bit out of the centre, but it is ideal for someone that wants to enjoy Amsterdam, without all the craziness of the centre. The tram stop is exactly in front of the hotel and the trams are very regular (every 5-6 minutes). Some of the staff could be friendlier, but that is also a common occurrence in the Netherlands. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Looks good, but it's not !”
Reviews.Author: Leodium
Reviews.Content: The whole hotel is based on the "green" attitude (meaning it's cheaper for them to run because green = cheap = an excuse if it's not too nice). There is no air conditioning, meaning the hotel is completely unusable during the summer months. It was 30Â°C in the room ! The mattress was quite strange, even in the premium room. Premium is only a name because the room was very small and really nothing special. The wifi coverage is just bad, in my case, only half of the room had a signal. The only positive point was the bathroom. The breakfast is bellow average, although the coffee was great. Conclusion : it's not extremely bad, but i will not go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: nekeyah
Reviews.Content: A trendy eco aware hotel. Room quiet as they gave us one away from the street. Clean and well appointed room, if a little small. Bed comfortable. Aircon worked. Twin towers which necessitated two lifts and a corridor but not really any problem. Situated on a busy street with plenty of restaurants around, and near a large park. Staff extremely friendly and helpful. Breakfast a little sparse. They had no cornflakes, but did have gluten free bread which was a plus. Free internet which worked well. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We'd stay here again”
Reviews.Author: jenksoccer21
Reviews.Content: Pros: -big open shower w/ great water pressure -nice staff -yummy organic breakfast buffet (10 Euro extra a person) -across the street from the tram -"green" hotel -not near the loud touristy areas -comfortable bed -trendy-looking room Cons: -no air conditioning -not near a lot of the sights (however, we wanted to walk everywhere...we could have taken the tram to get places faster, but chose not to....but sometimes it would have been nice to just walk out & be close to where we needed to go) -too far from other possibly cheaper breakfast locations to eat anywhere but the hotel (we like to eat right when we get up) -very uncomfortable pillows All in all, we'd stay here again. The price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, cool, comfortable, convenient and brilliant value.”
Reviews.Author: Skyros2001
Reviews.Content: The hotel is brand new with the kind of low-key style that the Dutch do brilliantly. The public area downstairs is like a funky living room with free WiFi and an airy cafe. The whole place is full of personality with quirky design touches and staff who come across as real people not automatons who've had all their humanity trained out of them. Our room was small, impeccably clean and quiet with hilarious wording on the door! Iit had the most comfortable bed we have ever slept in. Seriously. The shower was pretty special too and the notices reminding you how green the hotel is and asking you to think about saving water and towels are witty and light-hearted. Tram Number 1 is incredibly frequent and stops right outside the front door so we could be on Prinsengracht in a couple of minutes and the lovely Vondelpark was a minute's walk away so we could stroll across to the Van Gogh Museum. We had a brilliant weekend. Highlights were the amazing and innovative Envy Restaurant on Prinsengracht, an afternoon wandering around the Negen Straatjes and a long leisurely breakfast at the hotel. (Love the way the Dutch turn breakfast into a proper meal!) We'll definitely be back to Amsterdam and the Conscious Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value quirky hotel”
Reviews.Author: 55jim
Reviews.Content: This hotel met all our expectations. It was immaculately clean, the bedroom was comfortable with a generous sized bathroom. Particularly liked the large shower. Very impressed with the reception staff who were very helpful, polite and showed great patience. Car parking arrangements were excellent. Very handy hotel bike and scooter hire.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, eco friendly, no luxury”
Reviews.Author: EGHT
Reviews.Content: On the plus side: The hotel staff is friendly, the rooms are quiet, free internet, parking (at a charge, but a luxury in amsterdam), comfy bed. On the negative: A bit to many of: "Becuase we're an eco friendly hotel we do not have this and that", they are a bit to basic for the price they charge, ten minute tram ride to the city. I would possibly return, but compared to what they hype themselves up to be on their website I was a bit disapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Clean with green consciousness”
Reviews.Author: Directeur0
Reviews.Content: Besides cleanliness, you have the convenience of nearby Vondelpark for running, biking, etc. The tram #1 is outside the door although a relaxing walk through Vondelpark leads to the museum district. If you need services, across the street and to the right, you'll find everything from hairstyle to grocery. Nice pubs and restaurants are in the neighborhood although the 10 euro extra for the organic breakfast is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: ptang09
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel claims to be in the "city centre", it's really not. The tram is right outside the hotel which is very convenient, but by no means is it IN the city centre. The rooms were clean, but don't count on having a warm shower. The water goes from hot to cold throughout the 3 days we stayed. There's always this vacuuming sound going on throughout the night. At first we thought they were cleaning, but it doesn't stop. There's no restaurant in the hotel, and not many restaurants were appealing to us on Overtoom, so we walked all the way to city centre/ took the tram to grab a bite. I would say it's not the greatest value for your money considering you're paying more than 100 euros per night, but if you want something clean in amsterdam, Conscious Hotel is not a bad choice. Also, the price you pay on the website is BEFORE tax. They charge you the tax upon arrival and although the email says "Tax Included---......... no"...which we found to be very sneaky!!! so beware to pay an extra 10% on top of the price you're already paying on the website!!

Reviews.Title: “Good night sleep”
Reviews.Author: USESTATE
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at this hotel with my wife. Overall I would recommend this hotel. We had a very comfortable king size bed, and got the best sleep we have had in Europe. The hotel room is not to small with a good sized bathroom. To get to the hotel, just jump on the tram from central line (number 1 tram). The number one tram passes right by the hotel (on your left), you can not miss it. You could walk or bike from the hotel to any where, the hotel provides bike rental (24 hrs for I think 10 euro), but it does run out quick. Vondel park is located approx 30 second walk from the hotel. The staff was very knowledgable about Amsterdam and answered all of our questions. When it comes to getting back to the airport, make sure you have coins to pay for the train. We took the tram three stops lefts of the hotel, where we could of jumped on the train to the airport. while at the train stop we realized it did not except our credit cards, and only took coins (about 5.50 euros for 2 one way tickets). We ended up taking a 30 euro cab ride from the train station. You dont need to take a shuttle or taxi, save money and take the train to tram stop (save money). If you are visiting for several days buy a two day tram pass at the central station, if not you pay about 2.10 euros one way. Free internet in room. Only negative things about the hotel is it got a little loud at night, i would suggest a garden view room to keep the noise down, but all hotel are going to be this way. Also no ac, but it was cold when we where there (end of June). Also there is no free breakfast. Overall thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Another Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: lincolni
Reviews.Content: The main criteria I had when choosing a hotel in Amsterdam was that there it must have a lift and be adjacent to a tram stop. Hotel Concious met the requirement and the price! I read reviews and was prepared for disadvantages listed but they proved to be few. No kettle in room so we took one. Reception staff were excellent and luggage could be left in a room for which you are given a left luggage label. Bed very comfortable, rooms good size and clean, large bathroom with open shower. Stayed for 5 nights at end of June and room could get warm at night. Location for us was excellent as No1 tram is right outside and is very frequent into the centre and one stop away in the other direction to catch No17 tram to Anne Frank House. Ter Brugge Pub is directly opposite which does meals after 6pm and next to it a Herring stall. A short walk brings you to other cafe/restaurant and Vondelpark. I would suggest this hotel is not for party animals. It is located the right side of town for the airport which took less than 20 mins in a taxi for â‚¬30 with taxireservering.nl On the whole Trip Advisor reports for the hotel are pretty accurate

Reviews.Title: “I would stay again”
Reviews.Author: ecniv
Reviews.Content: The desk staff were very helpful; room was small but very clean. -odd hotel floor plan Public transit was very convenient - easy access to downtown or airport, or any part of the city [ recommend transit pass]. My room was very quiet - overall, a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent simple hotel”
Reviews.Author: SorrelliAuckland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with friends to visit Amsterdam for a few days. Very clean, well equipped and a bonus having car parking as part of the hotel - and yes, we did expect to pay for it. Very comforatable bed and good storage. Enjoyed being able to sleep with a window open and still have a quiet room. Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “trendy hotel in a non-touristy neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: ecdickinson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights at the beginning of a European vacation. It is easy to reach the hotel using the 1 line tram from Centraal Station. The neighborhood is removed from most of the tourist locations and sight-seeing, a quiet residential area along the big park. We enjoyed walking through the Vondelpark every day to get over to the museums and seeing the beautiful houses along the way. Our room did not have A/C - apparently not all rooms do - and we were a little warm with the window open during the day (night was fine). The wireless is easy to access, the rooms are set up well, we couldn't hear any of our "neighbors," and the bathroom was very modern and the provided toiletries great. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We enjoyed staying here for the two nights, then moving to another hotel in a different neighborhood at the end of our trip - you have to walk very far or take the train to get to other sight-seeing areas of the city, like Ann Frank's house.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, but not very central”
Reviews.Author: fasttravellers
Reviews.Content: This is a nice and clean hotel, we might consider staying at again. It is enviormental friendly, in a funny way; stickers and messages popped up everywhere with info about this and that. We only stayed there for one night, and the bed was FANTASTIC! The room was nice and clean. Really liked the interior, especially the wallpaper. The only thing that was a bit negative was that when we arrived, we had two huge siutcases with us. Our room was located in "b tower ", and it was some hassle getting there,...switching elevators,...manouvering through small hallways.,...at least we think they could have offered us some help. Breakfast was very good, but no bacon though...,boyfriend so disappointed ;) The hotel is located outside the city centre, near the beautiful Vondelpark...

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Hotel for Seeing Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeMunich
Reviews.Content: This hotel features modern dÃ©cor and comfortable beds. The staff is friendly and cheerful and the rooms are quiet; we heard absolutely no sound from other rooms. The hotel is conveniently located on the number 1 tramline, which takes you directly to the historical centre and all major attractions. It also backs onto the Vondelpark, Amsterdamâ€™s favourite park and is within walking distance of the Leidseplein restaurant district and two major museums , also on the tram line, Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum. Parking in Amsterdam is expensive, at 3-4 Euros per hour and almost impossible to find, so the hotelâ€™s garage, while it seems expensive, is a reasonable price. They will arrange bike rentals for you. Hotel breakfasts in Amsterdam are also very expensive. We enjoyed the Oslo cafÃ© across the street and over the bridge from the hotel for breakfast at a reasonable price. We took both the â€œ100 Treasuresâ€� canal tour and the 3 hour Yellow Bike Tour. Both are informative and enjoyable and highly recommended. The Canal tour starts across the street from the central train station and the yellow bike tour starts 500 metres from Dam Square .We also can recommend Abyssinia restaurant, on Overtoom Street a few minuteâ€™s walk from the hotel, for an enjoyable evening of African food in a cosy atmosphere. A good day trip from Amsterdam is to go to Central train station and walk through it to the sea side bus area and buy a â€œWaterland Ticketâ€� from the driver on an Arriva Bus, for 9 Euros. You can get off in the charming cheese village of Edam in about 45 minutes and from there after looking around you can use your ticket again to take another Arriva bus to Volendam (10 minutes), which is a touristy seaport. From there, for 5 Euros, you can take the Marken express ferryboat (30 minutes) and enjoy being on the sea for a while. The used-to-be-island has bike rentals, walking paths and interesting architecture. From there, you can use your Waterland Ticket again, to take a bus back to Amsterdam central train station.

Reviews.Title: “Best budget lodgings in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: DaveH-ExPat
Reviews.Content: The Conscious Hotel (Vondelpark) is a wonderful budget hotel located adjacent to central Amsterdam, with a tram stop outside giving easy access to the city. It is located on a main street running parallel to the Vondelpark, one of the main green spaces in the city and perfect for jogging, cycling, or picnicking. There is a friendly lobby with windowsills for reading and tables for talking, served by a small bar with drinks and snacks. Check-in is adjacent and the staff was helpful and quick (despite having to work around a changeover in computer systems). Rooms are modern and compact, yet comfortable and complete (we found no difference between the basic and deluxe rooms in size or style). The wall murals stand bright against the minimalist black and white of the rest of the room, but it works. The double bed is well sized and firm, there is a workspace (although the free wifi was weak outside the lobby), there is local cable TV, a small refrigerator, and an efficient bathroom with open shower stall. I didnâ€™t find as many restaurants within walking distance as others have indicated, and would recommend taking the tram into town to eat. The hotel serves a buffet breakfast but it is expensive (although coffee and tea is free). Itâ€™s probably better to take the tram into the town center to eat. The light afternoon snacks and evening drinks are good, though, and there are local pannekoeken and cafÃ© restaurants nearby for later in the day. Overall, this is an outstanding value for money in the city, with good location and fresh, new facilities. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Eco & excellent”
Reviews.Author: thewidds
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in an upgraded double. It was excellent, the bathroom superb and possibly had the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. The balcony was lovely especially as it was 30 degrees!! Would recommend this hotel and will be going back. The tram stops outside the door and all in all the hotel is in a superb location.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bododewit
Reviews.Content: excellent location to discover Amsterdam, next to Vondelpark, parking and rental bikes from hotel were very practical, good beds, very friendly personnel....!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RuthEllenThomas
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing and we can't say enough great things about it! Upon arrival, the staff were friendly and helpful and apologized that the lift only goes to the 5th floor and our room as on the sixth floor. This was not an issue! Not at all! One takes the lift to the 5th floor and it's only about twelve steps to our room. We had a rooftop terrace! Amazing views! The room was perfect for our needs--the size was perfect. Our first nght we stopped at a small market and then enjoyed chesse, fruit, bread and wine with lovely sunset views. On the website, you'll see what looks like a mural in the lobby--it's not a mural of greenery--it is actually an entire wall that has greenery growing out from it. The number 1 tram stops right outside the hotel--just mind your step to avoid getting hit by a cyclist! Whether you are a seasoned traveler to Amsterdam of this is your first time, you can't go wrong with the Conscious Hotel Vondelpark! They offer breakfast--I reviewed the "restaurant" as excellent. They also have a bar in the lobby with excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a one night stay!”
Reviews.Author: LDV15
Reviews.Content: We just finished our one night stay at this hotel and we enjoyed it very much. Conveniently located right in front of the tram platform in which a 24 hour tram pass allowed us to explore the city easily. Room was very clean but more pillows would have been more comfortable. No idea how to use the soap dispensers and was too inconvenient to ask, esp at the actual moment. No blowdryer and frankly not many tools to offer but good for one night stay! Front staff was very delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless eco-hotel in great city!!”
Reviews.Author: Yeahbaby81
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Conscious hotel Vondelpark for 3 nights in May and I must say this is one of the best hotels in Amsterdam! Located right next to the Vondelpark (the weather was great!), excellent organic breakfast and great staff! For an extra â‚¬10 we got the room on the topfloor which had a spacious roofterrace!
