The hotel is located in a quiet area, but there are still many nice restaurants and bars around. The last day we decided to rent an electric scooter at the hotel and we regret that we didn't do that sooner! A scooter (or bike but we are lazy) really is the best way to get around in Amsterdam, even though there is a tramstop right in front of the hotel. Would definately stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: LaGila
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Amsterdam for a week and we got back a few days ago. Amsterdam was great, but this hotel ruined a big part of the experience and we really regretted reserving it. the worst thing was definitely the bed. Oh my god, what a horrible bed!!! when we were lying on the mattress, it would sink in the middle to form a hole, so the whole night we slept in the most uncomfortable position and in the morning we got up with such backaches which lasted all day long, and it was like that for the whole week!!! The room was cleaned very poorly and the sheets were not replaced even when we put the sign that states "make me clean again" which the hotel provides. we had to pay extra taxes above what we paid when we ordered at hotels.com. The hotel is located in a god-forsaken neighborhood and there's nothing around it, no restaurants, no cafes, not even a small supermarket to buy things for the room. The structure of the hotel is weird, and we had to take 2 elevators + walk a corridor + going through 5 heavy doors to get to our room, every time!!! It was awful and we will never stay in this hotel again, even if we have to pay twice for another hotel. It's just not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean hotel, convenient location (though a bit far away from the Canal Ring)”
Reviews.Author: sergof
Reviews.Content: First, this hotel is very clean. Extremely clean. Obsessively clean, I would say. It is impractical to reach the hotel by foot from the area of main toursit attractions (~20 mins walk from Leidseplein), however, Tram 1 will take you to the hotel front in ~10 minutes. Get yourself a 24/48/72/96 hr public transportation card and you will be set. The rooms are bigger that an average Amsterdam hotel for an equivalent price level. Breakfast was OK, bu do not expect anything extraordinary. One drawback we suffered from is a lack of a curtain or a shielding plastic protecting the shower in the bathroom, which resulted in a completely wet floor after every shower we took. Maybe it's an environmental thing but that's definitely wrong. The staff is super friendly. Overall, we were very happy with our choice and definitely recommend this nice hotel to the others.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Pinkposhisland
Reviews.Content: Friendly staffs, helpful n cheerful Clean n new furbished room Love the shower Love the Eco friendly concept Tram station in front of the hotel Very convenience. It is close to both city center n airport. Breakfast is fantastic. Especially love the cheese n salami!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in every way”
Reviews.Author: SBnHV
Reviews.Content: Great value, great location, great service, clean and neat rooms, with very comfy bed, and the best thing was the breakfast. Had a lovely stay at this hotel. Only downside is probably the confusing layout, but we ended up making a game of trying to find the right way to the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but way overpriced”
Reviews.Author: lordnelso
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was good, but the value for money was terrible. For the amount we payed (~120 euros a night) we got a basic room with no tea making facilities (tea was available at the bar, but for a price!), no breakfast, unhelpful night staff and faulty key cards. Its a shame really, because the place was decent enough and most of the staff were really friendly. I'd say if it was about half the price I would have been really pleased with it, but when you pay through the nose you expect something more than a trendily decorated Travelodge....

Reviews.Title: “Quirky clean hotel in good location (bring own hairdryer)”
Reviews.Author: NicolaGail
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on Tram Line 01. Do not get a taxi from the train station, its a complete waste of money as the tram stop is literally outside the front door of the hotel. Located on the outskirts of Vondelpark, you can take a leisurely stroll through the very prettty park and be in the Museamplein within 15 minutes. There are some lovely coffeeshops en route. During our stay we took a slightly different route each day of our three day trip and took lots of photos of tulips, gorgeous riverbanks and the impressive fountain. Its location means you can be in Leidenplein within a 30 minute stroll or five minutes on the tram. The hotel itself is exceptionally clean, and the staff very friendly helpful and polite. Its an eco friendly hotel, and its for this reason I assume the rooms don't come with a hairdryer, you can borrow one but it takes a while. The breakfasts have simple choices but worth having.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, green, and efficient!”
Reviews.Author: indiehotel
Reviews.Content: We are actually still here - and wanted to write this review whilst in situ to make sure I did not forget anything. This hotel is very convenient - admittedly not right in the centre, but good if you want to avoid the bustle and ensure a good night sleep. It has very hip decor, with lots of reminders everywhere about its green philosophy which runs through everything. The room is clean and air conditioned, with a good sized bathroom and a fanstastic shower, shower gel and soap provided. There is also free wi-fi, hence my being able to do this review and all other travel related business conveniently. The staff are multilingual and very helpful - we had a problem with our safe, which was sorted out without any hassle. As for the food, we have not had breakfast here so cannot comment on that, but we did use the bar and they serve a good range of wines and beers. The location is great too as it is right on the No.1 tramline which takes you speedily into the central canal ring, so by being a bit out of the way you do not miss out. There are a good few restaurants and bars on Overtoom itself if you need to stay local at the beginning and end of your trip - we arrived quite late on Thursday and had a delicious meal in a bistro down the road populated by locals but with a menu in English and a helpful waitress. I would recommend this hotel very highly, it is clean and comfortable, good value, has a good philosophy, helpful staff, and is in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Environmental hotel - not that great”
Reviews.Author: kidhead
Reviews.Content: Very clean and tidy hotel, breakfast was very poor not much selection & didn't taste very fresh for the price, good location, rooms are a little basic for the price there was no hair dryer, tea/coffee facilities in the room,have stayed in cheaper hotels with better facilities. Overall a basic hotel but a tad over priced but still cheaper than a lot of hotels in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Going Green”
Reviews.Author: bobmel
Reviews.Content: Cool concept hotel. We had top floor room on street with terrace. Elevator did not go to the top floor so we had a one floor walkup. Room would be better if it was a little bigger and terrace a little smaller. Service was friendly but not great and some people did not seem to know too much about the hotel or the area. For example, the front desk should know where the recycling bins are in a green hotel and if there is a laundry in the area. The location was good if you did not mind taking the trolley outside of the main city center. Restaurants in the area within walking distance were a little sparse. Bed was comfortable. Breakfast good but expensive. Internet good and lobby was comfortable. Overall we liked the hotel but the staff did not really have their act together. An issue arose after our departure when our credit card was charged over $300 without any notice. Upon calling we were informed the charge was to pay for a broken chair in our room (which we knew nothing about). After a few email exchanges the hotel manager graciously agreed to reverse this charge and was going to investigate what happened.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: DirtyStinker
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely: modern, clean and funky! We spent 3 nights here and loved the quirkiness of the hotel, as well as the small (but perfectly formed) room. The bathroom was very chic with a great shower. The bathroom was a really good size! The only moan is that there was a whirring noise in the room constantly - caused by the fan in the bathroom. This was most annoying when trying to sleep at night!!! The number 1 tram stops immediately outside... And I also vouch for the amazing Pizza & Prosecco restaurant next door: delicious and excellent service!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel ,good value and not a bad location”
Reviews.Author: Russell1973
Reviews.Content: Good value hotel which provides a pleasant stay and a decent base to explore. The museum district is only ten minutes walk and thirty minutes walk to the RLD Trams outside the hotel are frequent if you can work out which door to get on! Few good eateries near the hotel including pizza restaurant next door, nice bar opposite in the corner. If you are looking to see the city on the hop give Mikes Bike Tour a go, great fun a good way to see Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean modern hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Eurotraveller58
Reviews.Content: Good clean hotel, with good staff on reception. Located in a quiet part of town with the number 1 tram stop directly outside the hotel. This runs through most of the busy parts of town and ends at Central station. We were asked if we wanted a quiet room and took this option, our room was in a secondary block linked to the main part of the hotel by a 'walkway' bridge. Being in the main block would havbe been a little closer to reception/bar/breakfast room and didn't appear to be any noisier than the 'quiet' rooms. Was offered breakfast at a 'special offer' price of 10 euros, but was poor value. If I stayed again (which I would) I'd buy a coffee and a pastry at the bar for half the price. If you write review text, it should be at least 50 characters, otherwise only your ratings will count.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cozy and fair priced”
Reviews.Author: Nanookh
Reviews.Content: I needed to stay for just one night and was surprised by the price/quality. The room was clean as was the bathroom/toilet. The bed was good (not too hard, and not too soft) and for â‚¬ 59.00 very neatly priced.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in a clean, bright hotel right on the tram line.”
Reviews.Author: DP2K
Reviews.Content: Hi, we stayed in the this hotel for a short holiday to Amsterdam. The hotel is about 15 mins by tram (No.1) to the city centre so is reasonably convenient. It is a new hotel with clean and well laid out rooms, which were a little on the small side. I recommend booking a room in a high floor as we did so the traffic/tram noises don't disturb. I would also suggest to the hotel that they produce instructions on how to dial reception - we had to dial out to speak to downstairs! Otherwise, would recommend this hotel to any future customer.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Good”
Reviews.Author: 23betty
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for one night in this hotel. On the positive side, we liked the green styling and theme, the hotel was quite cosy in the reception/bar area and the room was very clean if a little basic. No tea/coffee making but drinks available in reception. I hadn't brought a hairdryer or adapter plug and reception were quick to provide them when I asked. The bathroom was also exceptionally clean with a shower but no bath. Breakfast was an additional cost and wasn't very exciting so I would go out for breakfast if we stayed again. On the downside, it was a little further out of the city than we anticipated, although easy to get to by tram. Also, the member of reception staff on duty in the morning was very unhelpful and refused to print out our return flight boarding passes or help in any way which meant we had to spend an hour finding an internet cafe. I can understand this isn't always possible but her attitude was very off putting and left a bad impression.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: humphjon
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet comfortable. Right on the 1 tram less than 15min from Central Amstedam. (also possible to get 17 to Anne Franks nearby) Staff were welcoming and the room was comrfortable and felt like a much more pricey hotel. Definatly recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, clean, and eco-friendly”
Reviews.Author: A_Dangerfield
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Conscious for 3 nights, and really enjoyed it. The room was spotless, bright and airy. The bed is gigantic and so comfortable. The shower didn't have a curtain or door, but the extractor was effective so the bathroom dried quickly. The shower itself was lovely (and used 30% less water apparently, not that I noticed!). Couldn't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “This is simply the cutest, most original, lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: osaruby
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Amsterdam this winter with my mom and stayed at Conscious Vondelpark. We loved the hotel from the minute we walked in the door. The design is unique, modern, and artsy-- suited to our tastes exactly. I loved the green plant wall in the lobby and the adorable signs throughout the hotel. The beds were incredibly comfortable (most comfortable bed I've slept in in a while!) and the rooms clean. One thing I will note, however, is that the hotel bar was out of most of the food listed on their (adorable) menu. So, if you're hungry in the afternoon or evening, go next door to the Pizza and Prosecco restaurant (it's awesome, good value, and simply delicious). Also GET the breakfast buffet at the hotel. It features all organic, yummy food. You can eat enough good, wholesome food at the breakfast to last you for most of the day. If you can, opt for a room on the 1st floor. We had a great room on the first floor, but the elecrticity was out in it, so we were moved to the 2nd floor. Our 2nd room was fine, totally cute as all of Conscious hotel is, but was not as spacious or pretty as our first room (and the view wasn't as good-- try to get a room at the back of the hotel). Also, the free Wifi was appreciated, but it didn't work in our 2nd room (it did in our 1st room). I think this had to do with the placement of our room. It wasn't an issue though, as I enjoyed using the computer in the common areas throughout the hotel and in the chic lobby. Stay here. You WILL NOT get a better deal in Amsterdam-- it is exactly my taste and I would (will) stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy & nice but not the best”
Reviews.Author: londoner46
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very trendy and modern, the room is clean with nice decorations. Upon arrival (at night) the staff were very nice and welcoming. I stayed for 3 nights and on my first night after a long travel to Amsterdam I experienced a bad night sleep thanks to the bathroom's extractor fan, it was too noisy (natural noise of air coming) even when the bathroom door was shut, I phoned the reception at midnight and asked if there's a way I can turn it off but told it's impossible, I tried to sleep again but at 2am I had enough of it and went down to the reception to ask the member of staff to come and experience at problem - he came and almost fixed it by turning the part of extractor fan, so eventually I went back to sleep at 2:30am which is not ideal if you want to wake up at 8:00 to explore the city. The "Organic" breakfast was OK but not great - there's not much to choose from especially if you're a vegetarian. Wish it would offer a more variety. The location is so so, but when you use tram no. 1 it takes less than 5 mins to get to the heart of Amsterdam and 15 mins to Central station. When I checked out the receptionist wasn't really nice, she gave me the feeling she is trying to get rid of me. Overall I enjoyed my stay in the hotel and love to come back in the future...

Reviews.Title: “Fab room, very quirky”
Reviews.Author: CharlySugs
Reviews.Content: Room was lovely (white walls were a little marked in places!). Very quirky signs, loved the upside down plant!! Was very happy with it, the bed was fantastically comfy. Had a great view from the fourth floor. Wouldn't pay the 10 Euros for breakfast again though but that's mine and my husbands own personal opinions. We got dropped off at the Central Station - having never been to Amsterdam before we had no idea where to go so got a taxi - 19/20 Euros! There's the number 1 tram which drops you off right outside the hotel and you pay 7 Euros for 24 hours for the trams which'll take you anywhere. Takes a bit of getting used to. So from the station, get the number 1 tram. Can't really walk it, it'll take a while with big bags... Got to the vondelpaark, it was a lovely day when we went. I think going to this hotel let us see so much more than if we'd have stayed in one directly in the centre

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, 'clean', good location from visionary dutch planeteers”
Reviews.Author: BigDickSunday
Reviews.Content: This place is a bargain. Pretty good location half way down vondelpark which would come into its own in summer. Opted for slightly more expensive room, though still very cheap, decent size and quite nicely decorated. Really nice reception/cafe area and a gym right next door. Two things 1) When I went into my room there were already folk in there. Bit awkward. Reception, who were very pleasant, came up and gave me a new room but failed to come up with an adequate explanation. Apparently it had 'never happened before'. 2) They clean the rooms with water only. I mean there is a place for being eco friendly and a place for blitzing away any residue left by previous feral guests. I'd opt for the latter. That said, I appreciate their eco mission and while it gave me the heebie jeebies it did seem pretty clean.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, perfect, convenient”
Reviews.Author: jmann23
Reviews.Content: Such a nice hotel. Nice location, friendly, very English-oriented. Affordable. Small rooms but that's to be expected. Nicest bathroom I've ever had in a hotel. Great atmosphere, near public transportation (tram stop 25 ft from front door).

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've ever stayed in in Amsterdam - I will definitely book here again!”
Reviews.Author: KerryG47
Reviews.Content: The tram stop for the number 1 tram is right outside the door, so the hotel is easy to get to. My room was in the front section of the hotel, not enormous but still spacious, very comfortable bed and a nice table and chairs by the huge window. My bathroom didn't have a bath, but the walk-in shower was lovely. The bed is very comfortable, plenty of pillows for lounging, with more and an extra blanket in the wardrobe - I slept very well. Flat-screen TV with lots of channels, Dutch and English. The Vondelpark is just round the corner, excellent for walking and running, and the Oud-West and Oud-Zuid areas are fun to explore. The staff were friendly and helpful, the bar/coffee area was a nice place to relax and watch the world go by. The hotel feels very secure - you need your electronic room key to get past the lobby - and the room was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Beautiful and the amazingly comfortable bed! Book it.”
Reviews.Author: chemicachemica
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Amsterdam for the first time for one night for my partners birthday. I booked the hotel as it had good reviews here and to be honest it was cheap. I dont think I could fault the hotel on anything. The staff were polite and helpful, the rooms were clean, nicely decorated and genuinely had the comfiest bed I've ever slept on. The hotel was slightly furtherout of the city center than we had first thought but it is literally one street away from the Vondelpark which makes it actually a lovely walk back to the center. It's close to the main museums and plenty of restaurants and shops. As we're not really into going out and were completely exhausted by the nighttime we were there I cant really judge how well it's situated for clubs or bars but I did find that our room [in Tower B] was very quiet on a night time. I didnt realise until we started walking to the room but the hotel is actually two 'tower' buildings connected by an enclosed walkway. Eeverything is very well sign posted trhough so still nice and easy to get arounf the hotel and find your room and if anything I think this may be an added bonus as when we arrived we were offered the choice of either a front tower room witha street view or a back toweer room which would be quieter. All in all a lovely hotel well worth the [more than reasonable] price. Also well done for the environmental concept of the hotel which was more than followed through without ever feeling skimped on or preaching.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect modern hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CheenJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic, a little out of town but purchasing a 24hr bus, tram and train ticket for â‚¬7, the location was not a problem. It's about a 15minute tram journey, or a 35min walk to the centre. The rooms are spot on, clean, modern, spacious and basic. Rooms have a flat screen and an iPod dock. Bathroom shower is large and hot. The beds are comfortable, however if your not a fan of memory foam you may want to remove the topper. I personally love them. The hotel staff we very friendly and helpful. We purchased breakfast upon arriving for an additional â‚¬10 each. Its your typical continental breakfast, with various eggs to offer. We certainly got our money's worth. Plan on staying here again,

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, accomodating. Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sarahsarah22
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel online, unsure of what reality would hold for us, and were extremely relieved and pleased when we walked into the lobby. Perfect place to stay for two 30-somethings on a holiday! Besides being affordable, they may have the most comfortable beds in the world, its super clean and comfortable, and they were very accomodating when almost everything on our trip went wrong (lost luggage, food poisoning, locked safe that refused to open and give us our euros back, etc). Fantastic service from Tim especially, wonderful bartender and host! The tram is right outside the door, market and pharmacy just up the street, and the Vondelpark right beside. Also, perfect for those that dont want to stay right downtown with all the young kids. Very mature hotel, we'll go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, great Tim and it felt classy as hell !”
Reviews.Author: MasterMing
Reviews.Content: This was a great opportunity to wind down after a couple days of partyin in Amsterdam. Tim was the dude workin in the night and the staff and other guests were so friendly. He was able to spend the night workin away and also entertaining us with good food, drinks and enjoyable fun. I had a super early flight and tim provided a sandwich as well as a tea for me. Across the street is a nice pub that it was moreso locals which was great because I was able to meet some dutch speakers who also of course spoke english like most of the locals. Down the street is Vondelpark, and its quite beautiful out there. All in all, everything ruled and it was a great deal. Many deals online and Amsterdam was so much fun!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, eco-friendly and good value”
Reviews.Author: BernardZalm
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very nice, trendy atmosphere; the staff at the reception was very friendly. The hotel is eco-friendly (hence 'conscious') and reminds you of this via all kinds of messages which you will find everywhere ("Hi, I'm your towel") The standard room we booked was quite small, but clean and nicely decorated. The bathroom was fine; they don't give you small bottles of shampoo and soap, but dispensers with it are installed (more eco-friendly). There's also free wi-fi available on every floor. The breakfast was an additional charge of 13,50 EUR p.p. but was worth it; nice fresh products and good coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely clean hotel with excellent transport links and a comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: fayemouse
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent the weekend in Amsterdam recently and stayed at the Conscious Hotel Vondelpark. At first we were reluctant to stay in a 3* hotel but any apprehension disappeared as soon as we arrived. We had an excellent weekend away and I would not hesitate recommending this hotel to anyone. The room was warm (it was freezing outside!) clean and the staff were very helpful and provided lots of tips for in and around Amsterdam. The hotel itself is situated perfectly opposite a Line 1 (Tram line that takes you into the centre and to the central station in about 10 mins) Our room was situated on the same side as the main road and I must say, I didn't find it too loud or disruptive. The only thing I would advise is to be patient at breakfast time as this hotel is still finding its feet and it can be a little slow. I will definitely stay here again and intend on doing so when the weather heats up a bit!

Reviews.Title: “Just Forget about it”
Reviews.Author: vacati0nseeker
Reviews.Content: They are very rude and not flexible. They made us pay for the trip even though we haven't stayed at the hotel because of an emergency.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ayait
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 days. the hotel is beautifull , well Designed. a lot of small details which makes you belive that Someone really spent a lot of thought on how to make it a fun stay. the location is a bit problematic but there is a tram station one step from the hotel. it was a great experiance which made our trip great.

Reviews.Title: “At last, something different in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: VirtualOli
Reviews.Content: I opted for this hotel as it scored highly on TA, and I can see why. Good location, with a tram stop outside 10 minutes from Leidseplein. Really nice reception/cafe area, and good service. My room at the back of the hotel in B-Tower was square and spacious, with interesting upside down plants and nice lamps. Free internet was very fast. Large shower in the bathroom and very comfortable bed. A bit of outside noise at night, but not as much as I imagine the front of the hotel would have. The speech bubbles on the walls are a very nice touch - friendly and relaxing. Would not hesitate to book here next time I'm in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SIulian
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent;just a few stops from Museum Quarter with the tram no.1. The room was clean and quiet.The bathroom was spotless,and there were lots of nice tips about the reasons why this hotel is eco-friendly.The reception stuff was very helpful;they gave us a city map and told us about the main attractions.Breakfast was good(i suppose all those things were organic). There also a safe deposit, but we could not make it work.There is free Wifi Internet all over the hotel. Overall, an excellent place to stay;I definitely recommend it .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: potato2
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a trip to Amsterdam with my sister and the hotel was excellent - clean and bright, friendly and helpful staff, nicely decorated and green too!!! Our room was on the top floor with great views over the city and two lovely balconies - one from the bedroom and another from the bathroom!! Think that this may be the only room in the hotel with the two balconies but even without those the room was excellent - really nice and light. Its in the Vondelpark area so not right in the middle of the city centre but the tram stop is directly outside and only takes about 10 minutes to get to the city centre. I think the hotel only opened recently so everything is really lovely. Before we booked our hotel we checked loads on the internet and this was one of the cheapest in its range, so great value for money too.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, nice rooms, but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: hello143
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. It is located a few bus stops from the museum square and downtown. I found this green hotel very modern and comfortable. If you stay here, don't forget to bring your hair shampoo, hair conditioner, and lotion. There is no hair dryer in the room, but you can borrow one by calling the front desk. Two things bothered me during my stay: The shower had no curtain or door, so there was always a puddle on the bathroom floor. The noise from next door neighbors slamming the door always startled me. When housekeeping clean the rooms next door, it sounded like they were throwing furniture around. I'm a lazy traveler and like to sleep in. It's impossible to have any peace after 9am. If you don't mind the noise, this hotel has a lot to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of over booking”
Reviews.Author: carol_trower
Reviews.Content: We had booked to stay in this new hotel for 3 nights but on arrival we were asked to take a seat in the hotels snack bar. When we asked if there was a problem we were told by the receptionist "no". One hour and a free drink later! we were told that we did not have a confirmed booking - even though we presented the paperwork confirming the booking. They eventually informed us they were fully booked and could not accomadate us. They blamed our travel agent and would not take the responsibilty for this over booking, even though their system must have allowed this to happen as we were certainly not the only ones in this position. After much negociation - they did find us a room for one night. and it was a great experience with comfortable beds/pillows/ large shower room and a great breakfast with healthy options. The staff were friendly but the reception staff lacked, confidence, experience and people training and were very slow at booking people in, with guests waiting 30 mins. or more whilst they tried to sort out their over booking problem. So our 3 night break turned into a hotel hopping experience being in a different hotel each night. We trust this is just a teething problem in which we were the unfortunate recepients - as this hotel was comfortable, good value with good access to the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, even better value, should be a four star!”
Reviews.Author: JJofLA
Reviews.Content: By far this is one of the best values amongst Amsterdam hotels. It should be a four star hotel based upon the hip design, the comfortable rooms and beds, the flat screen TVs, the clean bathrooms, the eco-friendly touches, just to name a few. The hotel was just renovated, so everything is quite new and nice. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “feels good to enjoy and still contribute”
Reviews.Author: ivo_tol
Reviews.Content: all big parts make a bigger difference! i really enjoyed this hotel. being aware of doing something for a better world is so much better then trying to push it. as a designer the first thing i noticed where the pillows on the left side in the lobby. thumbs up for whomever thought of that. got my card key at the desk and then moved up for the room. first thing i always do is jump on the bed and have a 5 min powernap. if that feels good, the rest of the hotel is good. and it was. after a nap one needs a drink and i got served well at the bar. all in all a very nice hotel thats price wise is a bless. and leaving after the stay i can honestly say that i felt great.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - cozy and relaxing environment.”
Reviews.Author: Anne_Sark
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a true gem - the lobby is very welcoming and cozy, a place to enjoy coffee/ a drink and have a chat. The rooms are light, love the graphics and the small witty environmental messages spread in the space. Will definitely recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting & Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grace_on_Holiday
Reviews.Content: Great new hotel in Amsterdam. Love the contemporary and stylish design that is yet so sustainable and eco-friendly. The tram stops in front of the hotel for easy moving about in the city.

Reviews.Title: “great stay! lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sh2003
Reviews.Content: We went to Amsterdam to have a small holiday. We came by car and booked a parking space at the hotel for â‚¬ 22.50 which was a really good deal compared to the rates on the street. The hotel interior is nicely decorated and the panorama window in the bar has very nice authentic pillows where we enjoyed an afternoon tea. Check-in was efficient even though it was the first day the hotel was open! The hotel is sustainable and has all kinds of organic snacks, which is a nice plus. The room itself (standard double) is small, but very comfy and quiet. The beds were heavenly and decorated with a nice pillow with an old map of the city. Wifi is available throughout the hotel and is free. The breakfastroom was very crouded but we were seated immediately and the buffet (organic aswell!!) was refilled timely and of good taste and variety. The tram (line 1) stops in front of the hotel and takes you to the Leidse square within minutes! All in all we enjoyed our stay in Amsterdam and the Conscious Hotel Vondelpark and will certainly book here again when we visit Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, very good and nice rooms...”
Reviews.Author: sfgarcia79
Reviews.Content: A great hotel, very good and nice rooms, good bar and a perfect breakfast. It's the new pearl for Amsterdam.

HotelInfo.Name: Conscious Hotel Vondelpark
HotelInfo.Address: Overtoom 519-521, Amsterdam 1054 LH, The Netherlands
